Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2008 08:32PM Kgc wrote: Jenamae, I agree.  You should go somewhere else.  Last year when I was having an ultrasound, the tech seemed like she was in such a hurry to get done and could care less about trying to find the area of concern.  When I went back to my Dr. for follow-up.  the report said that everything was fine and nothing was seen.  Needless to say, the lump was huge and easily felt during my exam.  Fortunately the Dr. had been following it for quite some time and went ahead and took it out.  It ended up being benign but I would've been worried out of my mind if he hadn't.
Posts.Title: 20 and scared out of my mind!!! jenamae mbarnes
